content.description:
Vertical crack about 50 ft. to left of RR bolts. Small alcove, tricky start to vertical crack section. From the first main ledge head up into right leaning crack to top, past tree and easy climbing. Belay. Descend with single line rap from RR anchors.  

  The start is crux and the first section of vertical crack has a few hard moves. Easy ground gets you to the crux off width right leaning crack that will remind you of Sedona climbing.
content.protection: Doubles to #3, single #4. I didn't use any nuts and probably used about 1 1/2 rack.
content.location: Up the trail, around to the left to the north facing alcove of RR. Past the massive bolted roof and ascend the obvious crack system that leads to the top of the formation. Belay from a comfortable stance on top and then rap off the 2 bolt anchor for the bolted project, Raptor's Roost.

content.description: Nice trad route in good quality rock that takes a range of protection. Climb easy ground, placing horizontal protection to access the vertical crack that widens to the top. Some fun bulges and interesting moves lead to the top. Belay from the 2 bolt anchors on top of "Beak n Chains."
content.protection: Single rack to #4. Maybe some doubles.
content.location: Just to the right of the bolted line of "Beak n Chains", it's the prominent crack on the south facing face of the Roost Area. Last climb of the sub area before needing to walk a few 10s of meters to the "Talon's Grip Area."

content.description: Easy climbing starting left of chimney through chunky rock to big ledge. Ascend right arête with bolt and short crack to second ledge. Broken vertical crack system to 2 bolt anchor. Getting up into the higher crack system will remind you of Sedona climbing -- awkward, but somehow it all comes together and is just a bit burly.
content.location: Same start as Raptor's Roof, but bear right through the easy ground and then ascend the right arête instead of the overhanging crack from the first ledge.

content.description:
Bolted vertical face to massive roof, passing abandoned nest on ledge. Sustained and thin face climbing to ledge to roof. 

  THIS IS A PROJECT, please DO NOT send this route until we completely give up on it!!
content.location: Prominent roof in the north facing alcove of the area.

content.description: Easy climbing starting left of chimney through chunky rock to big ledge. Overhanging and committing finger to hand crack to second ledge with bolt on face below second crux through roof and steep face to 2 bolt anchor.
content.protection: Doubles of small to medium pro, single #2. 1 bolt.
content.location: Start just left of the big chimney, about 50' right of the base of Raptor's Roost start.

content.description: Short sport route on decent rock that will take you by surprise with its spiciness. Climb the low vertical face (nice pocket!) to ledge to shallow dihedral to crux small roof. Use directional for TR or to belay 2nd.
content.location: Just to the right of Hunting Ravens.

content.description: This is the arete/edge of the west facing wall and the north facing alcove area that hosts all the climbs to climber's left. It's a short little thing that has a few fun moves and some commitment because of the tricky pro. The hard 8/easy 9 move is to clear the small roof near the top. Climb broken crack through easy ground to a short face to overhanging crack to 2 bolt anchor.
content.protection: A few small and medium cams.
content.location: Farthest left corner of the west face. Northwest most point of the area.

content.description: Bullet hard rock, tricky thin pro and a few bolts -- this is a fun face climb! Will be committing to climb past the thin pro, but it's there and the delicate holds will be rewarding.
content.protection: 3 bolts and a few small cams. 2 bolt anchor that can be used for TR.
content.location: Pretty much the first face you see when you get to RR on the main trail. Nice big lunch ledge overlooking the valley.

climbs.name: Magic Raptor Ride
climbs.fa: Arjun Heimsath, David Sampson, Bridget Hatfield

content.description: Climb chimney past small tree in gully and ascend right face with single bolt and broken small crack system to ledge. Finger to hands crack with tricky pro. Nice ledge before the crux top part. 3 bolts protect crux arête to 2 bolt anchor.
content.location: Enter the recess just to the right of the start of the previous two climbs, which is a nice chimney that can be climbed free. Easy ground until you see the first bolt up and to the right.

content.description: Climb the same chimney as Magic Raptor Ride and continue up broken crack system to right of MRR to large ledge. Easy climbing to face with bolt protecting right arête to top. Tricky crux on arête that was totally unprotected on the ground up FA.
content.protection: Single rack, maybe doubles of small-medium cams.
content.location: Same start as MRR, so the first alcove/chimney as you wrap around the north side of the formation.

content.description: Climbs the better looking vertical crack about 10-15 to the right of Buzzard Bait. Rock quality is better, but there is still some loose stuff. MUCH improved since the last bout of cleaning and the summer rains last year. At the top of the crack move right and locate the bolts protecting somewhat tricky climbing up the arete.
content.protection: Single rack for the lower crack and 3-4 quick draws for the top part. Note that the 2-bolt anchor is ok for TRing "Beak n Chains", around on the south face, but not ideal for TRing "Django". Belay from top.
content.location: The rightmost crack system and arete of the west facing wall of the Roost Area.

content.description: Grungy looking wide crack that ended up being much cleaner than we expected. Definitely some loose rock still, even after climbing and cleaning, but it's much better than it looks (yes, it does look like a "what, me climb that?!" kind of route).
content.location: Right to the right of Free Flight on the west facing wall of the Roost Area.

content.description: Steep face climbing with a couple bulges to pass. The upper bulge has a bolt with a few chain links attached with a quick link to make it more easily clipable for the vertically challenged of us. Recall that bolt placement depends partly on rock quality. A fun and challenging route that definitely needs some thought.
content.protection: Sport, 7 bolts. 2 bolt anchor that can be used for TR.
content.location: First bolted line around on the south facing crag of the Roost Area. Just to the left of the prominent vertical crack, "Ravenclaw."

content.description: North side of Raptor Ridge, this is the namesake area that was what DAS was initially drawn to. A number of long trad lines ascend either side of the fully bolted visionary line, Raptor's Roost, that is still a project. These trad test pieces range from 5.9 to 5.12- and are exceptional examples of LD climbing. It's a shady area and is best saved for the warmer months. The west face routes get later afternoon sun and are shorter.
